item.title: Policies
item.description: Class: Class time is designed to be as interactive as possible. My role as instructor is to introduce you new tools and techniques, but it is up to you to take them and make use of them. Programming is a skill that is best learned by doing, so as much as possible you will be working on a variety of tasks and activities throughout each class. Grading: Your final grade will be comprised of the following:

item.title: Mini HW 1
item.description: Due: Aug 31 at 10:05am Required: The following items are required pieces of the assignment. They will not be graded for accuracy, only for completion. They are meant to serve as data collection to help me understand the statistical preparation of the class and to inform team assignments. Survey: Getting to know you Pretest: Comprehensive Assessment of Outcomes in a First Statistics course Student ID: Net ID Access code: OYT6817SLM Optional: Learn R module: Data basics

item.title:
Sta112FS
1 - Introduction
item.description: Syllabus General info Course website: http://www2.stat.duke.edu/courses/Fall17/sta112.01/ Grading Component Weight Participation 10% In class Exercises 10% Mini Homework 5% Homework 30% Midterm 1 15% Midterm 2 15% Final project 15% Grading (cont.) Class attendance is a firm expectation; frequent absences or tardiness will be considered a legitimate cause for grade reduction. Exact ranges for letter grades will be curved and cutoffs will be determined after the final exam.

item.title: Tools
item.description: GitHub R/RStudio GitHub is a web-based version control repository and Internet hosting service. We will be using GitHub in this course as a collaboration platform and a course management system (i.e. submit homework in GitHub as opposed to on Sakai). In order to get started, create a GitHub account, but before then, read about picking a good username. All course materials, including private repositories for students, are on the GitHub organization.
